page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Farming is the main activity in the area with a majority of{mixed dairy {and sheep farms. Most farms are owned and run by a family and are small to medium sized.They may employ one or perhaps two farmhands who often live on the farm in a cottage or caravan. Contract labour and machinery may be used for collection of silage or hay or at shearing time.Family and friends often help at busy times and farmers often help their neighbours. Markets at Bakewell and Chelford are important meeting places for social as well as business reasons. In Winter heavy snows can make life very demanding as fodder has to be taken out to the animals or the animals have to be brought in to shelter.
